question:
Which of the following is an example of application software?

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
solution:
• A word processor is a classic example of application software designed for document creation and editing.
  • Application software serves specific tasks for end users, unlike system software.
  • Examples include programs for word processing, spreadsheets, presentation, and database management.
  • It runs on top of the operating system to provide user‑oriented functionality.

Additional Information:

  • Web browsers (option a) are also application software for accessing the internet.
  • Programming languages (option b) are tools/languages, not end‑user applications.
  • Operating systems (option c) are system software that manage hardware and resources.
  • Application software often requires the system software (OS) to operate and interact with hardware.

question:
Which of the following is an example of system software?

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
solution:
• Windows operating system is a classic example of system software.
  • It manages hardware resources (CPU, memory, I/O) for the computer.
  • Provides a platform on which application software runs.
  • Ensures system security, process scheduling, and device control.

Additional Information:

  • System software includes operating systems, device drivers, and utility programs.
  • It operates in the background and is essential for basic computer functionality.
  • Without system software, applications cannot interact with hardware.
  • Updates to system software often include security patches and performance improvements.

question:
Application software includes a variety of programs that are designed to meet the information processing needs of _______________.

CHSL Exam 2024 Tier I
solution:
• Application software programs are developed to assist end users in performing specific information processing tasks.
  • They provide functionalities like document creation, data analysis, and communication.
  • Examples include word processors, spreadsheets, email clients, and media players.
  • Unlike system software, application software runs on top of the operating system to fulfil user requirements.

Additional Information:

  • Application software is classified into general-purpose (e.g., office suites) and special-purpose (e.g., CAD tools).
  • These programs often feature graphical user interfaces for intuitive interaction.
  • They rely on system software components like the OS kernel and device drivers.
  • Distribution models include retail, cloud-based, and open-source applications.

question:
Which of the following is NOT an application software?

CHSL Exam 2022 Tier I
option_4: Programming language translator software
solution:
• Programming language translator software (e.g., compilers, interpreters) translates source code into machine code, hence is system software, not application software.
  • Education software, Personal assistance software, and Entertainment software are all designed for end‑user tasks, qualifying as application software.
  • Application software directly addresses user needs (learning, assistance, entertainment), whereas translator software supports development processes.
  • Therefore, option (d) Programming language translator software is NOT an application software.

Additional Information:

  • Translator software acts as a bridge between human‑readable code and the machine’s instruction set.
  • System software encompasses the OS, device drivers, utilities, and translators.
  • Application programs depend on system software to interface with hardware and manage resources.
  • Translator tools are typically bundled with development environments rather than sold as standalone consumer applications.

question:
________ displays a list of utility configure the computer system and install software and hardware.

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• Control Panel displays a list of utilities used to configure the computer system and install or remove software and hardware.
  • Run simply launches commands.
  • Help and Support provides assistance topics.
  • Taskbar shows running applications and shortcuts.

Additional Information:

  • Accessing Control Panel: Right‑click the Start button or search “Control Panel” in the Start menu.
  • Applets Included: It contains System, Network, Programs, and Devices applets for various configuration tasks.
  • Migration to Settings: In newer Windows versions, many Control Panel functions are being migrated to the Settings app, though Control Panel remains available.

question:
Which of the following is not a LibreOffice Software Suite program?

CGL 2022 Tier-II Paper I
solution:
• LibreOffice Excel is not part of the LibreOffice suite.
  • LibreOffice Calc is the spreadsheet program in LibreOffice.
  • LibreOffice Impress is the presentation tool in LibreOffice.
  • LibreOffice Writer is the word‑processing application in LibreOffice.

Additional Information:

  • LibreOffice is a free and open‑source office suite derived from OpenOffice.org.
  • Excel is developed by Microsoft and included in Microsoft Office, not LibreOffice.
  • LibreOffice applications use .ods, .odp, and .odt file formats for Calc, Impress, and Writer respectively.

question:
Which of following is in-house software of the Indian Railway to tackle the problem of cattle getting run over by the trains?

RRB Group-D 17/09/2022
option_1: Smart Event Tracking System
option_2: Animal Tracking and Vigilant System
option_3: Indian Railway Tracking System
option_4: Cattle Tracking Collar System
solution:
• Smart Event Tracking System is an in‑house software of Indian Railways designed to address cattle run‑over incidents.
  • It monitors trackside events such as cattle presence using sensors and CCTV to alert train controllers in real time.
  • It helps reduce accidents by providing immediate alerts to drivers and control centres.

Additional Information:

  • Developed by the Centre for Railway Information Systems (CRIS) specifically for event‑tracking needs.
  • Integrates data from trackside sensors, cameras, and train‑borne units for comprehensive monitoring.
  • Deployed across vulnerable sections to enhance safety and minimise livestock fatalities.

question:
Which app has been released first time by the Ministry of Education to learn spoken sentences in 22 languages?

RRB Group-D 30/08/2022 (Shift-III)
solution:
• Bhasha Sangam was the first app released by the Ministry of Education to learn spoken sentences in 22 languages.
  • IEPFA, SARATHI, and ENGLISH PRO are not related to this initiative.
  • The app provides phrase‑by‑phrase learning across all scheduled Indian languages.

Additional Information:

  • Launched in August 2022 by the Ministry of Education under the Ek Bharat Shreshtha Bharat programme.
  • Developed by the National Translation Mission in collaboration with NCERT.
  • Contains 1,000 common sentences translated into 22 Indian languages for interactive learning.

question:
Which of the following is a multi user operating system?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 31/07/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Unix is a multi‑user operating system that allows multiple users to access system resources simultaneously.
  • MS‑DOS, Windows‑7, and iOS are primarily single‑user systems.
  • Therefore, Unix is the correct answer.

Additional Information:

  • Unix supports distinct user accounts, permissions, and concurrent sessions on the same machine.
  • MS‑DOS and Windows‑7 permit only one local user session at a time without specialized server configurations.
  • iOS is designed for a single user per device and does not natively support multiple simultaneous user profiles.

question:
Which software is more useful for presentation in a classroom?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 14/03/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Microsoft PowerPoint is specifically designed for creating and delivering slide‑based presentations in a classroom.
  • Microsoft Access is a database management tool, Microsoft Excel is for spreadsheets, and Microsoft Word is for word processing.
  • PowerPoint offers features like slide templates, animations, and multimedia support tailored for presentations.

Additional Information:

  • Slide Templates: Pre‑built designs help create professional‑looking slides quickly.
  • Multimedia Integration: You can embed images, audio, and video to enhance engagement.
  • Presenter Tools: Presenter View, slide notes, and laser‑pointer features aid effective delivery.

question:
Ubuntu, Mint and Fedora are versions of:

RRB NTPC Stage-I 13/03/2021 (Shift-I)
option_1: Apple MAC OS X
solution:
• Ubuntu, Mint, and Fedora are distributions of the Linux operating system.
  • They share the Linux kernel and come with package managers such as APT (Ubuntu/Mint) or DNF (Fedora).
  • These distributions are free, open‑source, and popular on both desktops and servers.

Additional Information:

  • Linux distributions vary by package management, default desktop environment, and release cycle.
  • Ubuntu is based on Debian; Mint builds on Ubuntu; Fedora serves as an upstream for Red Hat Enterprise Linux.
  • A large global community maintains, supports, and contributes to Linux development.

question:
Operating system of a computer is an example of:

RRB NTPC Stage-I 27/02/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Operating system (OS) acts as system software that manages hardware resources and provides services to applications.
  • Hardware refers to physical components and is not software.
  • Application software runs on top of the OS and relies on system software.

Additional Information:

  • System software includes the OS, device drivers, and utility programs.
  • OS examples: Windows, Linux, macOS.
  • Application platform isn’t a standard software category; it denotes frameworks that support applications.

question:
Which of the following options defines Operating System?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 12/01/2021 (Shift-I)
option_1: It is a software that is used to convert source program instructions to set programs
option_2: It is a set of program used to convert high level of language to low level language
option_3: It is a set of programs that controls the way a computer works and runs other programs
option_4: It is the actual way of working on computers
solution:
• Operating System is a set of programs that controls the way a computer works and runs other programs.
  • Option (a) describes software for converting source program instructions to object code (an assembler), not an OS.
  • Option (b) refers to a compiler that converts high‑level language to low‑level language, not an OS.
  • Option (d) is vague and does not correspond to any standard software category.

Additional Information:

  • Resource Management: The OS manages CPU, memory, and I/O devices for efficient operation.
  • User Interface: Provides command‑line or graphical interfaces for user interaction.
  • Process Control: Schedules and controls processes, ensuring multitasking and security.

question:
A/An __________ is an interface between the user and hardware.

RRB NTPC Stage-I 23/01/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Operating System provides the interface between the user and hardware.
  • Memory is a storage component, not an interface.
  • Screen and Command are I/O components, not software interfaces.

Additional Information:

  • It translates user instructions into hardware‑level commands.
  • It manages and allocates hardware resources like CPU and memory.
  • It offers user interfaces such as graphical UI and command‑line shell.

question:
Which type of computer application software is Quattro Pro?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 12/02/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Quattro Pro is designed for creating and managing spreadsheets, organising data in rows and columns.
  • It provides advanced features such as formulas, functions, and charting tools for data analysis.
  • It enables users to automate repetitive tasks through macros and cell‑based computations.

Additional Information:

  • Originally developed by Borland and later acquired by Corel, Quattro Pro competes with other spreadsheet software.
  • It supports multiple file formats, including its native .qpw and Microsoft Excel’s .xls/.xlsx.
  • Quattro Pro offers data import/export capabilities and integration with other office suites.

question:
Which among the following is NOT an example of an Operating System?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 12/02/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• MS Office is not an operating system; it is an application suite.
  • UNIX, Linux, and Windows are all operating systems that manage hardware and software resources.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is MS Office.

Additional Information:

  • Operating Systems provide core services such as process scheduling, memory management, and device control.
  • MS Office includes programs like Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, which run on top of an operating system.
  • Common OS examples include Windows, macOS, Linux distributions (e.g., Ubuntu), and UNIX variants.

question:
What is the function of WinZip?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 10/02/2021 (Shift-I)
option_1: This is a antivirus software
option_2: It compresses large files into a smaller file
option_3: It extracts smaller file from larger files
option_4: It expands smaller files into a large file
solution:
• WinZip is a utility that compresses large files into a smaller file, which is its primary function.
  • It is not antivirus software that detects or removes malware.
  • While WinZip can also extract (decompress) files from archives, its main feature is file compression.

Additional Information:

  • Supported Formats: WinZip handles ZIP along with other archive types like 7Z and RAR.
  • Compression Algorithms: It uses methods such as Deflate to reduce file sizes efficiently.
  • Security Features: You can create encrypted, password‑protected archives and split large archives into multiple parts.

question: Which of the following is NOT an anti-virus software?
solution:
• Oracle is not antivirus software; it is a database and enterprise software company.
  • McAfee, Kaspersky, and Norton are all well‑known antivirus programs.

Additional Information:

  • Antivirus Software: Designed to detect, prevent, and remove malware.
  • Oracle Products: Include database management systems, middleware, and cloud solutions.
  • Common AV Features: Real‑time scanning, threat removal, and automatic updates.

question:
In Microsoft Excel, a workbook is a collection of:

RRB NTPC Stage-I 01/02/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Workbook in Excel is a collection of worksheets.
  • Charts and Photos can be embedded in worksheets but are not what a workbook is composed of.
  • Word books is not a valid Excel term.

Additional Information:

  • Worksheets are individual tabs within a workbook where you enter and analyse data.
  • You can add, delete, rename, and reorder worksheets to organise your workbook.
  • A single workbook file (with extension .xlsx) can contain multiple worksheets.

question:
Which of the following is/are an example of utility program?

RRB JE CBT-II 28/08/2019 (Evening)
option_1: All of the options
solution:
• Utility programs perform system maintenance tasks such as malware protection, network management, and file compression.
  • Antivirus software detects and removes malicious software to protect system integrity.
  • Network managers and file compression utilities optimize connectivity and storage; hence all listed options are utility programs.

Additional Information:

  • Utility programs support system software by enhancing performance and reliability.
  • They differ from application software by focusing on hardware and system resource management.
  • Common utilities include disk defragmenters, backup tools, and system monitors.

question:
Which of the following is NOT an ‘Operating System’?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 27/01/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Tally is accounting software, not an operating system.
  • Android is a mobile operating system developed by Google.
  • Ubuntu and Mint are Linux‑based operating systems.

Additional Information:

  • Android uses a Linux kernel customised for mobile devices.
  • Ubuntu is based on Debian, while Mint is derived from Ubuntu.
  • Tally is primarily used for financial accounting and ERP.

question:
When a computer virus attaches itself to another computer program, it is known as ___________.

RRB NTPC Stage-I 03/04/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Trojan horse is the term for malware that attaches itself to another computer program.
  • It hides within a host program and activates when the infected program is run.
  • It can replicate and spread by infecting other executables on the system.

Additional Information:

  • Unlike standalone viruses, a Trojan horse requires user execution of the host program to trigger its payload.
  • The legitimate program that gets infected is called the host program.
  • Trojan horses often carry malicious payloads such as backdoors, keyloggers, or data‑stealing routines.

question:
Who invented the Linux software?

RRB SSE 21/12/2014
solution:
• Linus Torvalds invented Linux, so None of these (Option d) is the correct answer.
  • Linux is an open‑source, monolithic kernel–based operating system.
  • It serves as the foundation for numerous distributions such as Ubuntu, Mint, and Fedora.

Additional Information:

  • Initial Release: The first Linux kernel (version 0.01) was announced in September 1991.
  • Licensing: Linux is distributed under the GNU General Public License (GPL), allowing free use and modification.
  • Adoption: It powers everything from personal computers to servers, embedded systems, and supercomputers.

question:
Which of the following is NOT a database software used on computers?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 02/03/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• MS Word is not a database software; it is a word‑processing application.
  • Oracle, FoxPro, and MS Access are all database management systems used to store and retrieve data.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is MS Word.

Additional Information:

  • Database Software provides tools for creating, managing, and querying structured data.
  • Microsoft Access, FoxPro, and Oracle support SQL and offer features like data relationships, forms, and reports.
  • MS Word focuses on document creation and editing, lacking any database management capabilities.

question:
The speed of a microprocessor is known as:

RRB NTPC Stage-I 15/02/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Clock Speed indicates the number of cycles per second executed by the microprocessor.
  • It is measured in Hertz (Hz), often in Megahertz (MHz) or Gigahertz (GHz).
  • Higher clock speeds generally correlate with faster instruction execution but are not the sole performance metric.

Additional Information:

  • Clock cycles define the rhythm at which the CPU processes instructions.
  • Factors such as cache size and architecture also impact overall performance.
  • Modern CPUs often adjust clock speed dynamically using technologies like Intel Turbo Boost.

question:
Which of the following web browsers is NOT a proprietary software?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 15/02/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Mozilla Firefox is an open‑source browser released under the Mozilla Public License.
  • Internet Explorer, Opera, and Safari are distributed as proprietary software.
  • Therefore, Mozilla Firefox is the browser that is not proprietary.

Additional Information:

  • Source Availability: Mozilla Firefox’s source code is publicly available and can be modified.
  • Internet Explorer: Developed by Microsoft as closed‑source software.
  • Safari & Opera: Safari is Apple’s proprietary browser; Opera also includes proprietary components.

question:
Which of the following is a programme that translates each instruction of high-level language and executes it before passing on to the next instruction?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 31/01/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Interpreter translates and executes each high‑level instruction one at a time before moving to the next.
  • Compiler (in contrast) converts the entire program into machine code first, then executes it.
  • Assembler translates low‑level assembly language into machine code, not high‑level languages.

Additional Information:

  • Debugging Ease: Interpreters allow immediate execution, making it simpler to test and debug code step by step.
  • Portability: Because source code is executed directly, interpreted programs can run on any platform with the appropriate interpreter.
  • Performance Trade‑off: Interpretation is generally slower than compiled execution due to repeated parsing at runtime.

question:
Which of the following is the system designed to prevent unauthorized access to or from a private network?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 31/01/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Firewall is designed to prevent unauthorized access to or from a private network.
  • Repeater regenerates and forwards network signals, not used for access control.
  • Packet filter examines packet headers against rules but isn’t a full access‑control system.
  • Bridge connects network segments at the data‑link layer without security enforcement.

Additional Information:

  • Firewall Types: Includes network‑level, application‑level, and next‑generation firewalls.
  • Deployment: Placed between a private network and the internet to monitor and control traffic.
  • Capabilities: Can perform stateful inspection, traffic logging, and intrusion prevention.

question:
What is the full form of ASCII?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 13/01/2021 (Shift-II)
option_1: American Standard Code for Information Interchange
option_2: American Stable Code for Information Interchange
option_3: American Standard Code for International Interchange
option_4: American Stable Code for Institutional Interchange
solution:
• ASCII stands for American Standard Code for Information Interchange.
  • It is a 7‑bit character encoding standard used to represent text in computers and communication equipment.
  • Characters such as letters, digits, and control codes are mapped to numerical values (0–127).

Additional Information:

  • Origin: First published in 1963 by the American National Standards Institute (ANSI).
  • Control Characters: Includes non‑printable codes like BEL (bell) and LF (line feed).
  • Extended ASCII: Uses 8 bits to support additional symbols and accented letters (values 128–255).

question:
Which of the following is application software?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 07/01/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Graphics is application software designed for tasks such as image editing and digital art.
  • macOS, UNIX, and LINUX are operating systems, classified as system software.

Additional Information:

  • Application software runs on top of system software and performs specific user‑oriented functions.
  • System software manages hardware resources and provides a platform for applications to execute.

question:
Who is the founder of Facebook?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 30/12/2020 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Mark Zuckerberg founded Facebook in 2004 while studying at Harvard University.
  • He co‑founded it alongside Dustin Moskovitz, Eduardo Saverin, Andrew McCollum, and Chris Hughes.
  • It was originally launched as “Thefacebook” exclusively for Harvard students.

Additional Information:

  • Facebook rapidly expanded to other universities and opened to the public in 2006.
  • It became a publicly traded company in May 2012 under the ticker symbol FB.
  • Today, Facebook is part of Meta Platforms and serves over 9 billion monthly active users.

question:
Which among the following is NOT open source software?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 08/04/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Microsoft Office is not open‑source software.
  • Linux, Android, and Mozilla Firefox are all released under open‑source licences.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is Microsoft Office.

Additional Information:

  • Proprietary Suite: Microsoft Office is developed and maintained by Microsoft as proprietary software.
  • Linux Kernel: Linux is an open‑source kernel forming the basis of many distributions.
  • Open‑Source Licences: Android (AOSP) and Mozilla Firefox use permissive or copyleft licences that allow free use and modification.

question:
Process content, which is freely accessed over the internet and is open in further use and improvement by the user and is generally developed in a collaborative way is known as –

RRB JE 14/12/2014
option_1: Elite source process material
option_2: Lassen bean process material
solution:
• Open source material refers to content freely accessible over the internet and open for further use and improvement by users.
  • It is generally developed collaboratively, allowing contributions from a community of users and developers.
  • Source code or content is unrestricted, promoting transparency and innovation.

Additional Information:

  • Licensing: Open source materials are typically governed by licenses like MIT or GNU GPL, which define usage and distribution rights.
  • Community‑driven: Development relies on community involvement for bug fixes, enhancements, and documentation.
  • Applications: Examples include Linux, the Apache web server, and Wikipedia as a knowledge resource.

question:
Which of the following computer viruses damages the formatting of a document and does not allow it to edit?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 03/03/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Macro viruses infect document files and corrupt their formatting, preventing them from being edited.
  • Boot sector viruses target disk boot records, file viruses infect executables, and worms replicate over networks—none specifically damage document formatting.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is Macro virus.

Additional Information:

  • Macro viruses are written in macro languages embedded within applications like Microsoft Word or Excel.
  • They execute automatically when an infected document is opened, running harmful code.
  • Modern antivirus solutions detect and remove macro viruses by scanning document macros.

question:
Which of the following is the latest version of Android?

RRB JE Stage-II 31/08/2019 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Android Pie (9.0) is the latest version among the options.
  • Android Oreo (8.0/8.1) preceded Pie.
  • Android Nougat (7.0/7.1) preceded Oreo.
  • Android KitKat (4.4) is much older.

Additional Information:

  • Android Pie Release: Launched in August 2018.
  • Key Features: Introduced Adaptive Battery, gesture navigation, and Digital Wellbeing.
  • Naming Scheme: Up to Pie, Android versions followed dessert names in alphabetical order.
